author: camplefield
content: Hello, I have a question on the withdrawal functions. Is there the ability to specify a different withdrawal address for rewards and for the 32 ETH principle directly on the validator? Or is this something you have to with a proxy smart contract used as withdrawal address?

author: jameshe5018
content: you can only specify 1 address and it can't be updated. if you specify a smart contract , it won't be able to trigger any code

author: camplefield
content: ok, thanks. This is news to me, interesting. Why has this decision been made?

author: camplefield
content: With this, it is not as easily possible as it is on delegated PoS setups, to have the service provider getting some parts of the staking rewards and the delegator getting the rest.

author: jameshe5018
content: i've written it up! haha https://offchain.medium.com/deposits-locked-withdrawals-minted-a7e975708b3d but a more official official faq https://notes.ethereum.org/@launchpad/withdrawals-faq

author: jameshe5018
content: well you can it just takes another transaction, the withdrawal itself just can't trigger it

author: camplefield
content: ok, makes sense. Thanks a lot for your help, will check out your write-up as well
